result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Deval Combs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Pay all applicable surcharges, costs and disbursements.  To be paid ftrom prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amoaunts in full would result in a civil judgment entered which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employmetn.  Be given job and vocational training.
Mental health evaluation. Follow any treatment regiment recommended.

No contact with Shkh U., Real Deal Convenience Store located at 1412 N. 27 Street in the City and County of Milwaukee, WI.

Remain alcohol free.
Cognitive thinking intervention cousneilng.  Parenting classes.
Aoda assessment and treatment. Urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. jbs
Defendant's petition for sentence adjustment returned because he has not served sufficient confinement time to be eligible to file a petition.
Defendant's petition for sentence adjustment under sec. 973.195, Stats, returned to defendant because he has not served the applicable percertage of confinement time to file a petition.
Original Transcript (21 pages) commencing on 05-09-2014 SENTENCING received and filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed. rn

Defendant Johnny Deval Combs in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Johnny Deval Combs in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.     Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Johnny Deval Combs not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Johnny Deval Combs in court with Trisha Fritz, student intern under the supervision of Richard Johnson for attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Johnny Deval Combs in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Affirmed for the state:Marco Salaam-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SHEIKH U. OR 1412 N 27TH ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW).
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Johnny Deval Combs in court with  Student Intern TRISHA FRITZ under the supervision of attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Johnny Deval Combs in custody.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
